title: Jim Justice
added: The [[United Mine Workers]] endorsed Justice's opponent Ben Salango after having previously endorsed Justice in his 2016 gubernatorial campaign. However, Justice did receive the endorsement of the West Virginia Coal Association, saying Justice had "worked to protect the miners, increase coal production, and explore innovative ways to use coal for new products and downstream job opportunities".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wvmetronews.com/2020/08/19/justice-gets-endorsement-from-w-va-coal-association-after-salango-gets-umw/|title=Justice gets endorsement from W.Va. Coal Association after Salango gets UMW|first=Brad|last=McElhinny|work=[[West Virginia MetroNews]]|date=August 19, 2020|access-date=February 5, 2021}}</ref>

title: Jim Justice
added: In February 2021, Justice urged Senator [[Joe Manchin]] to vote for the $1.9 trillion stimulus package proposed by President [[Joe Biden]], warning against being "fiscally responsible" and adding, "I don't really know exactly what the thinking could possibly be there. I mean, we got people that are really hurting."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackbrewster/2021/02/01/republican-gov-jim-justice-adds-pressure-on-manchin-to-pass-stimulus-not-the-time-to-be-fiscally-responsible/?sh=773f67aef23d|title=Republican Gov. Jim Justice Adds Pressure On Manchin To Pass Stimulus: Not The Time To Be 'Fiscally Responsible'|first=Jack|last=Brewster|website=Forbes.com|publisher=[[Forbes]]|date=February 1, 2021|access-date=February 5, 2021}}</ref><ref name="Go Big">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/03/us/politics/jim-justice-manchin-west-virginia.html|title=Jim Justice, a G.O.P. Governor, on Why Biden Needs to ‘Go Big’ on Covid Aid|first=Trip|last=Gabriel|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=February 3, 2021|access-date=February 5, 2021}}</ref>
